DataElement.preferredName: Person Opportunistic Infection Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response to whetther an infection caused by an organism which becomes pathogenic under certain conditions, e.g., during immunosuppression.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Opportunistic Infection Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._An infection caused by an organism which becomes pathogenic under certain conditions, e.g., during immunosuppression._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Opportunistic Infection Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An infection caused by an organism which becomes pathogenic under certain conditions, e.g., during immunosuppression.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Infection caused by an organism that is capable of causing disease in immunocompromised patients only (e.g. HIV-positive or transplanted patients).--2004
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a history o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of opportunistic infection within 6 months of screening including tuberculosis, severe cytomegalovirus (CMV) or herpetic infections (such as disseminated herpes, herpes encephalitis, ophthalmic herpes)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection; positive for CMV DNA by PCR up to 28 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection; positive for CMV DNA by PCR?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is cytomegalovirus (CMV) polymerase chain reaction (PCR) positive at baseline?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection or is known to be CMV PCR positive at baseline?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active cytomegalovirus (CMV) (positive serology for anti-CMV IgM antibody and negative for anti-CMV IgG antibody or positive CMV PCR with clinical manifestations consistent with active CMV infection) and requiring therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history of CMV end organ disease within 6 months (180 days) prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known or suspected chronic active EBV or CMV infection?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.4.4 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002268. ak
